content:
Contrast

This creature is most similar to a dog



Physical

Shape, colour, size etc



Habitat

Where they live ie. geographic distribution



Movements

How many limbs, can fly (with or without wings)



Basic Need

Requires oxygen, water, food and sleep



Nutrition

Canivorous, prefers to eat rat



Interaction

How they communicate with their environment ie. senses like sight and sound, camouflage, mimicry



Growth

Rate of growh, maturity, developemental milestone



Excretion

Types and frequency e.g. Faeces, sweat, carbon dioxide, urine, molting, shed fur



Reproduction

Genders, types of mating, offsprings, internal or external fertilisation), infant care(e.g. lactation)



Culture

How the creature are viewed in the society, dispicted in literature, films or even flags



Life cycle

Average life span, weakness and strengths, and predators



More
